Apakah Korban Fintech Ilegal Harus Bayar Utangnya?
02 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Foto: Tim Infografis Andhika Akbaransyah

Jakarta - Satuan tugas waspada investasi sejak awal tahun hingga akhir Oktober 2019 sudah memblokir 1.773 aplikasi fintech abal-abal alias yang tak mengantongi izin dari Otoritas Jasa Keuangan (OJK).Pemblokiran dilakukan karena banyak fintech yang mengancam dengan kekerasan, memberikan bunga tinggi, biaya administrasi yang tinggi hingga penyebaran foto pribadi. Meskipun sudah diblokir, Ketua Satgas Waspada Investasi Tongam L Tobing mengungkapkan untuk peminjam yang sudah memiliki kewajiban pembayaran utang, harus menuntaskan terlebih dahulu. Hal ini karena sudah ada persetujuan sejak awal meminjam di aplikasi tersebut."Memang kami tidak menolerir tindakan pelecehan, kekerasan (yang dilakukan saat penagihan), tapi peminjam ini harus bayar utang dulu. Jangan karena ilegal jadi tidak dibayar utangnya. Ya harus bayar," kata Tongam, Sabtu (2/11/2019).Dia mengungkapkan, termasuk penyelesaian pemberlakuan bunga yang dikenakan per hari. Menurut Tongam, saat meminjam banyak masyarakat yang dengan mudah menekan tombol yes atau oke di aplikasi. "Pinjam sejuta dikirim Rp 600 ribu oke aja, bunganya per hari oke aja, diminta akses ke kontak handphone, dia oke aja dan dia deal. Tapi (saat jadi korban penagihan) pemerintah yang disalahin," ujarnya.Tongam menjelaskan, meskipun sudah diblokir. Peminjam tak bisa lepas dengan bebas. Pasalnya pihak aplikasi pasti memiliki data dan dia akan menggunakan data tersebut untuk penagihan selanjutnya. "Dia pasti akan kejar terus, makanya utang itu harus dibayar," imbuhnya.Namun, banyak pula masyarakat yang melakukan pinjaman kepada fintech ilegal tersebut untuk kegiatan konsumtif bukan produktif. "Masyarakat yang bilang pinjaman online menyengsarakan mungkin karena tidak tahu manfaatnya. Dia pinjam untuk kegiatan konsumtif," ujarnya.Padahal, kata dia, tak sedikit juga masyarakat yang terbantu oleh adanya fintech pinjaman online tersebut. Terutama mereka yang tidak memenuhi persyaratan untuk meminjam ke perbankan.Hingga saat ini terdapat 127 fintech pinjaman online yang terdaftar di OJK dan semua nasabahnya tidak ada yang merasa dirugikan. Bahkan yang melakukan pinjaman untuk modal usaha terbantu mengembangkan bisnisnya. Sementara yang kerap menjadi korban adalah masyarakat yang meminjam pada perusahaan ilegal."Saat ini berjumlah 127 (fintech lending legal) dengan 14,4 juta nasabah dan dana Rp 10,1 triliun kegiatan fintech lending yang terdaftar. Ini sangat membantu masyarakat, tidak ada komplain dari 14 juta nasabah. Mereka menikmati dalam kehidupan mereka dan meningkatkan pendapatan mereka," tutupnya.Simak Video "1.230 Fintech Ilegal Dibekukan Selama Tahun 2018-2019"[Gambas:Video 20detik](kil/eds)

Do Illegal Fintech Victims Have to Pay Their Debts?
02 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Photo: Andhika Akbaransyah Infographic Team

Jakarta - The investment alert task force since the beginning of the year to the end of October 2019 has blocked 1,773 fake fintech applications that do not have licenses from the Financial Services Authority (OJK). The blocking was carried out because many fintechs threatened with violence, providing high interest, administrative costs. high up to the spread of personal photos. Even though it has been blocked, the Chairperson of the Investment Alert Task Force Tongam L Tobing revealed that for borrowers who already have debt repayment obligations, must complete it first. This is because there was an agreement from the beginning to borrow in the application. "Indeed, we do not tolerate acts of harassment, violence (which is done when billing), but this borrower must pay the debt first. Do not because it is illegal so the debt is not paid. said Tongam, Saturday (11/02/2019). He revealed, including the completion of the imposition of interest charged per day. According to Tongam, when borrowing many people who easily press the yes or okay button in the application. "Borrowing a million Rp 600 thousand is okay, the interest per day is okay, requested access to cellphone contacts, he is okay and he is a deal. But (when he was a billing victim) the government was blamed," he said. Tongam explained, even though it had been blocked. Borrowers cannot escape freely. Because the application must have data and he will use the data for further billing. "He will definitely continue to pursue it, so the debt must be paid," he added. However, many people also make loans to illegal fintech for consumptive rather than productive activities. "People who say online loans are miserable because they do not know the benefits. He borrowed for consumptive activities," he said. In fact, he said, not a few people were helped by the existence of online loan fintech. Especially those who do not meet the requirements to borrow from banks. Until now there are 127 online fintech loans registered with OJK and none of their customers feel disadvantaged. Even those who make loans for venture capital are helped to develop their business. While those who are often victims are the people who borrow from illegal companies. "At present there are 127 (fintech lending legal) with 14.4 million customers and funds of Rp 10.1 trillion registered fintech lending activities. This really helps the community, there are no complaints of 14 million customers. They enjoy in their lives and increase their income, "he concluded.
